Description: Brokers employed by BGC on its emerging markets foreign exchange options desk made false representations that certain bids and offers were executable and that certain trades had occurred.
Brokers employed by GFI on its emerging markets foreign exchange options desk made false representations that certain bids and offers were executable and that certain trades had occurred.

BGC Financial and GFI Securities agreed to pay penalties totaling $12.5 million to resolve violations of the Martin Act. Both brokerage firms admitted that between January 1, 2014 and December 31, 2015, brokers of foreign exchange currency options for emerging market currencies employed fraudulent practices.
